alert.note: Alert for Campbell; Scott (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 20 at 1:23PM CDT until July 20 at 5:45PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT/7 PM CDT/ THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following areas, Anderson, Bledsoe, Blount Smoky Mountains, Campbell, Knox, Loudon, McMinn, Meigs, Morgan, North Sevier, Northwest Blount, Northwest Monroe, Rhea, Roane, Scott TN, Sevier Smoky Mountains and Southeast Monroe. * WHEN...Until 8 PM EDT/7 PM CDT/ this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Showers and storms are expected to continue in the area, extending the threat of flash flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
